trans-unit.source: WS-Federation Identity Providers
trans-unit.target: WS-Federation Identity Providers

trans-unit.source: Azure
trans-unit.target: Azure

trans-unit.source: WS-Federation Identity Providers
trans-unit.target: WS-Federation Identity Providers

trans-unit.source: WS-Federation identity providers are custom identity providers that support the WS-Federation protocol and are configured in <token>firstref_acs</token> using WS-Federation metadata.
trans-unit.target: WS-Federation identity providers are custom identity providers that support the WS-Federation protocol and are configured in <token>firstref_acs</token> using WS-Federation metadata.

trans-unit.source: A WS-Federation identity provider may also support other federation protocols, such as WS-Trust.
trans-unit.target: A WS-Federation identity provider may also support other federation protocols, such as WS-Trust.

trans-unit.source: WS-Federation identity providers are most frequently used in web site and web application scenarios, where the WS-Federation passive requester profile is used to facilitate the necessary token redirects to and from <token>secondref_acs</token> using a web browser.
trans-unit.target: WS-Federation identity providers are most frequently used in web site and web application scenarios, where the WS-Federation passive requester profile is used to facilitate the necessary token redirects to and from <token>secondref_acs</token> using a web browser.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Active Directory Federation Services 2.0
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Active Directory Federation Services 2.0

trans-unit.source: A common example of a WS-Federation identity provider is <token>firstref_adfs2</token>.
trans-unit.target: A common example of a WS-Federation identity provider is <token>firstref_adfs2</token>.

trans-unit.source: You can use it to integrate your enterprise Active Directory accounts with <token>secondref_acs</token>.
trans-unit.target: You can use it to integrate your enterprise Active Directory accounts with <token>secondref_acs</token>.

trans-unit.source: Before you can add and configure <token>secondref_adfs2</token> as an identity provider in <token>secondref_acs</token>, you must have <token>secondref_adfs2</token> installed and working with at least one Claims Provider Trust, for example, Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS).
trans-unit.target: Before you can add and configure <token>secondref_adfs2</token> as an identity provider in <token>secondref_acs</token>, you must have <token>secondref_adfs2</token> installed and working with at least one Claims Provider Trust, for example, Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS).

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="dbc91fd8-672a-4eb9-941a-1d6a2beaa615" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How To: Configure AD FS 2.0 as an Identity Provider</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="dbc91fd8-672a-4eb9-941a-1d6a2beaa615" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How To: Configure AD FS 2.0 as an Identity Provider</link>.

trans-unit.source: Configuring in the ACS Management Portal
trans-unit.target: Configuring in the ACS Management Portal

trans-unit.source: When you are using the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal to configure a WS-Federation identity provider, you must enter the following data.
trans-unit.target: When you are using the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal to configure a WS-Federation identity provider, you must enter the following data.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Display name</embeddedLabel>—Specifies the display name of your identity provider.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Display name</embeddedLabel>—Specifies the display name of your identity provider.

trans-unit.source: This name is used in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal only.
trans-unit.target: This name is used in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal only.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>WS-Federation metadata</embeddedLabel>—Contains configuration information (federation metadata) about the established federated services, such as tokens and authorization, and the policies for accessing them.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>WS-Federation metadata</embeddedLabel>—Contains configuration information (federation metadata) about the established federated services, such as tokens and authorization, and the policies for accessing them.

trans-unit.source: When you add a WS-Federation identity provider in <token>secondref_acs</token>, you must enter the URL of the federation metadata document or upload a local copy of the metadata document for the WS-Federation identity provider.
trans-unit.target: When you add a WS-Federation identity provider in <token>secondref_acs</token>, you must enter the URL of the federation metadata document or upload a local copy of the metadata document for the WS-Federation identity provider.

trans-unit.source: Import WS-Federation metadata only from a WS-Federation identity provider that you trust.
trans-unit.target: Import WS-Federation metadata only from a WS-Federation identity provider that you trust.

trans-unit.source: For security reasons, it is strongly recommended that the WS-Federation identity provider publish their federation metadata document at an HTTPS URL.
trans-unit.target: For security reasons, it is strongly recommended that the WS-Federation identity provider publish their federation metadata document at an HTTPS URL.

trans-unit.source: It is also recommended that the WS-Federation identity provider use only HTTPS token-issuance endpoints.
trans-unit.target: It is also recommended that the WS-Federation identity provider use only HTTPS token-issuance endpoints.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Login link text</embeddedLabel>—Specifies the text that is displayed for this identity provider on the login page of your web application.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Login link text</embeddedLabel>—Specifies the text that is displayed for this identity provider on the login page of your web application.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="e23d5f14-f36b-478a-935d-b753fa0cf4d0" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Login Pages</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="e23d5f14-f36b-478a-935d-b753fa0cf4d0" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Login Pages</link>.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Image URL (optional)</embeddedLabel>—Associates a URL with an image file (for example, a logo of your choice) that you can display as the login link for this identity provider.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Image URL (optional)</embeddedLabel>—Associates a URL with an image file (for example, a logo of your choice) that you can display as the login link for this identity provider.

trans-unit.source: This logo automatically appears on the default login page for your <token>secondref_acs</token>-aware web application, as well as in your web application’s JSON feed that you can use to render a custom login page.
trans-unit.target: This logo automatically appears on the default login page for your <token>secondref_acs</token>-aware web application, as well as in your web application’s JSON feed that you can use to render a custom login page.

trans-unit.source: If you do not specify an image URL, then a text login link for this identity provider is displayed on the login page of your web application.
trans-unit.target: If you do not specify an image URL, then a text login link for this identity provider is displayed on the login page of your web application.

trans-unit.source: If you specify an image URL, it is strongly recommended that it be pointed to a trusted source, for example, your own web site or application, using HTTPS to prevent browser security warnings.
trans-unit.target: If you specify an image URL, it is strongly recommended that it be pointed to a trusted source, for example, your own web site or application, using HTTPS to prevent browser security warnings.

trans-unit.source: Also, any image that is larger than 240 pixels in width and 40 pixels in height is automatically resized on the default ACS home realm discovery page.
trans-unit.target: Also, any image that is larger than 240 pixels in width and 40 pixels in height is automatically resized on the default ACS home realm discovery page.

trans-unit.source: It is recommended that you obtain permission from your <token>secondref_adfs2</token> partner to display this image.
trans-unit.target: It is recommended that you obtain permission from your <token>secondref_adfs2</token> partner to display this image.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Email domain names (optional)</embeddedLabel>—To prompt users to login using their email address, you can specify the email domain suffixes hosted by this identity provider.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Email domain names (optional)</embeddedLabel>—To prompt users to login using their email address, you can specify the email domain suffixes hosted by this identity provider.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, leave this field blank to display a direct login link.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, leave this field blank to display a direct login link.

trans-unit.source: Use semicolons to separate the list of suffixes.
trans-unit.target: Use semicolons to separate the list of suffixes.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="e23d5f14-f36b-478a-935d-b753fa0cf4d0" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Login Pages</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="e23d5f14-f36b-478a-935d-b753fa0cf4d0" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Login Pages</link>.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Relying party applications</embeddedLabel>—Specifies all existing relying party applications that you want to associate with this identity provider.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Relying party applications</embeddedLabel>—Specifies all existing relying party applications that you want to associate with this identity provider.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="16708a9e-e1f1-4ad5-bed2-a49ccabc42b9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Relying Party Applications</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="16708a9e-e1f1-4ad5-bed2-a49ccabc42b9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Relying Party Applications</link>.

trans-unit.source: After an identity provider is associated with a relying party application, rules for that identity provider must be generated or added manually in a relying party application’s rule group to complete the configuration.
trans-unit.target: After an identity provider is associated with a relying party application, rules for that identity provider must be generated or added manually in a relying party application’s rule group to complete the configuration.

trans-unit.source: For more information about creating rules, see <link xlink:href="7ef0ec98-9fa8-4671-bcf7-630ebb06ec7e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Rule Groups and Rules</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about creating rules, see <link xlink:href="7ef0ec98-9fa8-4671-bcf7-630ebb06ec7e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Rule Groups and Rules</link>.

trans-unit.source: Supported claim types
trans-unit.target: Supported claim types

trans-unit.source: After a user authenticates with an identity provider, they receive a token populated with identity claims.
trans-unit.target: After a user authenticates with an identity provider, they receive a token populated with identity claims.

trans-unit.source: Claims are pieces of information about the user, such as an email address or a unique ID.
trans-unit.target: Claims are pieces of information about the user, such as an email address or a unique ID.

trans-unit.source: <token>secondref_acs</token> can pass these claims directly through to the relying party application or make authorization decisions based on the values they contain.
trans-unit.target: <token>secondref_acs</token> can pass these claims directly through to the relying party application or make authorization decisions based on the values they contain.

trans-unit.source: By default, claims types in <token>secondref_acs</token> are uniquely identified using a URI for compliance with the SAML token specification.
trans-unit.target: By default, claims types in <token>secondref_acs</token> are uniquely identified using a URI for compliance with the SAML token specification.

trans-unit.source: These URIs are also used to identity claims in other token formats.
trans-unit.target: These URIs are also used to identity claims in other token formats.

trans-unit.source: For WS-Federation identity providers, the available claim types are determined by the WS-Federation metadata for the identity provider that is imported into <token>secondref_acs</token>.
trans-unit.target: For WS-Federation identity providers, the available claim types are determined by the WS-Federation metadata for the identity provider that is imported into <token>secondref_acs</token>.

trans-unit.source: Once the import is complete, the claim types available for the identity provider are visible in the <ui>Edit Claim Rule</ui> page of the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: Once the import is complete, the claim types available for the identity provider are visible in the <ui>Edit Claim Rule</ui> page of the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: These claim types are also visible through the ClaimType entity in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service.
trans-unit.target: These claim types are also visible through the ClaimType entity in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service.

trans-unit.source: In addition to the claim types available through WS-Federation metadata, <token>secondref_acs</token> always issues the following claims for each WS-Federation identity provider.
trans-unit.target: In addition to the claim types available through WS-Federation metadata, <token>secondref_acs</token> always issues the following claims for each WS-Federation identity provider.

trans-unit.source: Claim Type
trans-unit.target: Claim Type

trans-unit.source: URI
trans-unit.target: URI

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Name Identifier
trans-unit.target: Name Identifier

trans-unit.source: http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/nameidentifier
trans-unit.target: http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/nameidentifier

trans-unit.source: A unique identifier for the user account, provided by the identity provider.
trans-unit.target: A unique identifier for the user account, provided by the identity provider.

trans-unit.source: Identity Provider
trans-unit.target: Identity Provider

trans-unit.source: http://schemas.microsoft.com/accesscontrolservice/2010/07/claims/IdentityProvider
trans-unit.target: http://schemas.microsoft.com/accesscontrolservice/2010/07/claims/IdentityProvider

trans-unit.source: A claim provided by <token>secondref_acs</token> that tells the relying party application that the user authenticated using the selected identity provider.
trans-unit.target: A claim provided by <token>secondref_acs</token> that tells the relying party application that the user authenticated using the selected identity provider.

trans-unit.source: The value of this claim is visible in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal via the <ui>Realm</ui> field in the <ui>Edit Identity Provider</ui> page.
trans-unit.target: The value of this claim is visible in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal via the <ui>Realm</ui> field in the <ui>Edit Identity Provider</ui> page.

trans-unit.source: WS-Federation identity providers can also issue claim types to <token>secondref_acs</token> that are not explicitly listed in the identity provider’s WS-Federation metadata document.
trans-unit.target: WS-Federation identity providers can also issue claim types to <token>secondref_acs</token> that are not explicitly listed in the identity provider’s WS-Federation metadata document.

trans-unit.source: In this case, the expected claim type URI can be entered manually into a rule instead of selected.
trans-unit.target: In this case, the expected claim type URI can be entered manually into a rule instead of selected.

trans-unit.source: For more information about rules, see <link xlink:href="7ef0ec98-9fa8-4671-bcf7-630ebb06ec7e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Rule Groups and Rules</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about rules, see <link xlink:href="7ef0ec98-9fa8-4671-bcf7-630ebb06ec7e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Rule Groups and Rules</link>.

trans-unit.source: Managing Certificates
trans-unit.target: Managing Certificates

trans-unit.source: The X.509 token signing certificates for a WS-Federation identity provider are listed on the page for the identity provider in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: The X.509 token signing certificates for a WS-Federation identity provider are listed on the page for the identity provider in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: It is important to monitor the certificates and ensure that they are effective and that they are replaced before they expire.
trans-unit.target: It is important to monitor the certificates and ensure that they are effective and that they are replaced before they expire.

trans-unit.source: To view the certificates for a WS-Federation identity provider:
trans-unit.target: To view the certificates for a WS-Federation identity provider:

trans-unit.source: In the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal, click <ui>Identity providers</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal, click <ui>Identity providers</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Click the WS-Federation identity provider.
trans-unit.target: Click the WS-Federation identity provider.

trans-unit.source: Scroll to the <ui>Token Signing Certificates</ui> section at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Scroll to the <ui>Token Signing Certificates</ui> section at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: For more information about managing certificates for WS-Federation identity providers, see <link xlink:href="dea613c9-e35c-4731-9411-e7937837b3bb#BKMK_WS-Fed" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">WS-Federation identity provider certificate</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about managing certificates for WS-Federation identity providers, see <link xlink:href="dea613c9-e35c-4731-9411-e7937837b3bb#BKMK_WS-Fed" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">WS-Federation identity provider certificate</link>.
